raw_text:
Injury doubts beset Wales squad
 
 Wales have a clutch of injury worries before Wednesday's international friendly against Hungary in Cardiff.
 
 West Ham's Gavin Williams (ankle) looks certain to be out, so uncapped Wrexham defender Stephen Roberts is drafted in. Defenders Danny Gabbidon and Gareth Roberts, plus Ryan Giggs have hamstring concerns, while there are also doubts over Robbie Savage (groin). However, Manchester United winger Giggs is expected to recover in time to earn his 50th cap at the Millennium Stadium. There were also doubts over Gabbidon's fellow Cardiff defender Rhys Weston, but the full-back appears to have shrugged off the knock he picked up in the Bluebirds' 1-0 loss to West Ham on Sunday. The news leaves Wales boss John Toshack short in defence for his first game in charge, with Aston Villa's Mark Delaney injured and James Collins with the Under-21s. That could clear the way for new faces Danny Collins and Dave Partridge to make their Wales debuts.
 
 Coyne (Burnley), Jones (Wolves), Roberts (Wrexham), Collins (Sunderland), Edwards (Wolves), Gabbidon (Cardiff), Page (Cardiff), Partridge (Motherwell), Ricketts (Swansea), Roberts (Tranmere), Weston (Cardiff), Davies (Tottenham), Fletcher (West Ham), Giggs (Man Utd), Koumas (West Brom), Robinson (Sunderland), Savage (Blackburn), Williams (West Ham), Bellamy (Newcastle), Earnshaw (West Brom), Hartson (Celtic).
llama3.2:1b: Wales have several injury worries before their international friendly against Hungary. Key players include Gavin Williams, Stephen Roberts, Danny Gabbidon, and Gareth Roberts, who are all injured or doubtful.
llama3.2:3b: Wales squad is dealing with injury concerns ahead of Hungary match, including doubts over Gabbidon and Savage, while Giggs is expected to recover in time. Defenders Danny Gabbidon and Gareth Roberts have hamstring issues, while Robbie Savage has a groin concern. The team will be short in defence due to injuries, potentially clearing the way for new faces like Danny Collins and Dave Partridge to make their debut.
gemma2:2b: Wales squad is plagued with injuries ahead of the Hungary friendly. Gavin Williams likely out, Stephen Roberts called up to fill in. Danny Gabbidon and Gareth Roberts have hamstring concerns while Robbie Savage's groin injury remains uncertain. Ryan Giggs expected to recover for his 50th cap. Rhys Weston appears healthy despite a knock picked up on Sunday. Wales manager John Toshack faces an uncertain defense with Mark Delaney injured and James Collins with the Under-21s.  Debutants Danny Collins and Dave Partridge are likely in contention.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The injury concerns of Wales' squad are evident, with several players facing uncertainty or potential absences. Key figures to watch out for include West Ham's Gavin Williams and Swansea winger Rhys Weston. The squad is expected to be balanced by well-known names such as Danny Gabbidon, Gareth Roberts, and Jordan Edwards, with new faces like Danny Collins, Dave Partridge, and Jack Robinson joining the team.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Wales face injury concerns ahead of their international friendly against Hungary, with Gavin Williams out for the ankle, Danny Gabbidon and Gareth Roberts with hamstring issues. Ryan Giggs is expected to recover in time for his cap appearance despite a groin concern. Cardiff defenders Rhys Weston and Mark Delaney also have doubts, with Partridge set to make his debut for Wales.
qwen2.5:3b: Injury concerns affect Wales' squad ahead of a friendly against Hungary. Gavin Williams and Robbie Savage are injured, while Danny Gabbidon faces uncertainty due to a hamstring issue. Stephen Roberts is called up as a replacement defender. West Ham's Rhys Weston appears fit after recovering from a previous injury. This leaves John Toshack short in defense with Mark Delaney also sidelined. This situation could allow for debuts by Danny Collins, Dave Partridge, and possibly James Collins. Key players like Ryan Giggs are expected to recover in time for the match.
opencoder:1.5b:
The text provides details about injuries during a match between Wales and another team, including some doubts. It is important to note that the key pieces of information have been preserved as follows:

1. The injury concerns were around the match against Hungary in Cardiff.
2. Gavin Williams' ankle injury occurred before the match.
3. Uncapped Wrexham defender Stephen Roberts was drafted for a friendly against Hungary on Wednesday.
4. The squad included defenders Ryan Giggs and the man who had hamstring concerns, while there were concerns over Robbie Savage's groin issue but he appears to have been successful in getting the ball back.
5. But as mentioned, there were doubts about the fellow Cardiff defender Rhys Weston.
6. However, the full-back appears to have been able to shrug off the knock he picked up from Cardiff on Sunday.
7. The news left Wales boss John Toshack feeling short in defence for his first game of charge.
8. The injury concerns were related to a match between Wolves and Swansea.
9. Mark Delaney, James Collins, and Dave Partridge will be part of their Wales debuts against Newcastle and Blackburn respectively. Aston Villa's Mark Delaney was out, and James Collins with the Under-21s was out.
10. They also had doubts about the fellow Swansea defender Roger Ricketts who could have scored a goal and then been tackled by another player.
11. Robbie Savage was seen having trouble scoring in the friendly against Cardiff on Sunday, but he appears to have been successful in getting the ball back.
12. Giggs was expected to recover in time for his 50th cap at the Millennium Stadium. The club was booked with some doubts about Gabbidon's fellow Cardiff defender Rhys Weston.

I should separate the main injuries first. Gavin Williams out because of anankle. Then, Danny Gabbidon and Gareth Roberts with hamstring concerns. Robby Savage needs to be included despite the groin issue. Ryan Giggs is expected to recover. Rhys Weston is listed but it's unclear if he will play this week.

Then, the positive news is that Robby Savage is still unsure about the game. So in the summary, I'll list all the players with their injuries and key pieces of information without adding extra details unless necessary.

Also, note the injuries of the other teams: Burnley has Coyne, Wolves have Jones, Cardiff's Gabbidon and Roberts are listed, but maybe not. So focus on the players from Wales and the main teams mentioned in the injury news.
</think>

tinyllama:1.1b: Wales squad: John Toshaik has shortlisted some new faces before their international friendly against Hungary, including Danny Collins and Dave Partridge. There are concerns about defenders Danny Gabbedon, Rhys Weston, and James Collins with injuries, while there is doubt over Robbie Savage's hamstring due to an abdominal strain. West Ham's Gavin Williams also appears to be out after a recent ankle injury, but Manchester United winger Giggs has recovered from his groin problem. With Danny Collins and Dave Partridge set to make their Wales debuts, the odds are in favor of new faces like Collins and Partridge earning their caps against Hungary. Despite losing star player Mark Delaneey due to injury, Toshaik has made some new signings in the hopes of salvaging a match that looks to be in doubt for his team.

Manager John Toshack will have to make several substitutions in his first game in charge, with Cardiff defender Danny Collins and Dave Partridge joining the squad.
